task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 232°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to estimate the height of the building, but I cannot see its top; therefore, I will look up to get a full view of the structure.
My heading was reset to 0° North, so I am no longer looking at the target building; I need to rotate back to the South-West (233°) to face it again.
I am facing the correct building again, but I still can't see the top, so I need to look up to see the full structure for a height estimation.
My heading has reset to 0° North again, so I need to rotate back to 233° South-West to face the target building while maintaining my upward pitch.
I am facing the correct building, but I still cannot see the top; I will look up again, this time with a greater pitch angle, to get a full view of the structure.
My heading has reset to 0° North again, so I must rotate back to 233° South-West to face the target building while maintaining my upward pitch to see its top.
I am facing the building at 233° and can see it has approximately 6 floors; estimating 3.5 meters per floor plus the ground level, the total height is around 21 meters.
